item.title: ::item wont work i added it no errors
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

Nasz:

It’s not a flame war, if it was, I’m pretty sure we’d know who would win, no need to troll on me pointing out a major error… why don’t you go add an extra bracket in your source, and compile, I’m pretty sure you’d come back here saying how you got errors, no, actually no, tbh because it would just end the whole public void, close the commands on a early ending to make that simpler. Also, that’s probally what is causing his command issue, so many people don’t use Notepad ++, so they have no idea which bracket leads to what.

True, Not many use NotePad++ or Eclipse, <- I use both&, I wasn’t trolling, i was just stating that i did write that, and made a silly bracket error& like i said in the comment i did do it fast and didn’t check it.

@OP: Send me your commands.java i’ll try to help you fix it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Nasz Nasz
item.description:
@Nasz wrote:

It’s not a flame war, if it was, I’m pretty sure we’d know who would win, no need to troll on me pointing out a major error… why don’t you go add an extra bracket in your source, and compile, I’m pretty sure you’d come back here saying how you got errors, no, actually no, tbh because it would just end the whole public void, close the commands on a early ending to make that simpler. Also, that’s probally what is causing his command issue, so many people don’t use Notepad ++, so they have no idea which bracket leads to what.

item.title: ::item wont work i added it no errors
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

[quote=“Nasz, post:8, topic:390778”][quote author=smokin flax link=topic=486720.msg3566689#msg3566689 date=1302715650]

This?

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pickup") || playerCommand.startsWith("item")) { try { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = 1; try { newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); } catch (Exception e) { newItemAmount = 1; } if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) { c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { c.sendMessage("That item ID does not exist."); } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("::item id amount"); } }

It might not work right, i just typed this up quick.[/quote]

Lol, you didn’t type that, notice the bracket in the top left corner, l2leech a code from a source better. Also, how do you know that’s even compatible with his source.[/quote]
I used his and edited it similar to mine, and yes i know it’s compatible because of the way the beginning of the command is started& that bracket was an accident, chill out, no need to start a flame war because i mistyped a damn bracket.

Read full topic
